programme.title: Mickey Mouse Mixed-Up Adventures
programme.sub-title: Campy Camper Day!/ Founder's Day Flounder!
programme.desc: While on a camping trip, Mickey, Donald and Daisy can't unplug from their electronic devices. Mickey and the gang celebrate the 100th birthday of Hot Dog Hills.

programme.title: Mickey Mouse Mixed-Up Adventures
programme.sub-title: One Unicorny Day!/ The Happy Horse Helpers!
programme.desc: When a horse gets a traffic cone stuck on her head and is sprayed with sparkly paint, the townsfolk think they've seen a real unicorn.

programme.title: Puppy Dog Pals
programme.desc: The pugs help their nervous puppy cousin, Cody, feel comfortable in a new place. When Hissy’s favorite toy goes missing, the pups go on a mission to find it for their kitty sister.

programme.title: Puppy Dog Pals
programme.sub-title: What to Expect When You're Egg-specting/ Ruffin' It
programme.desc: While in New Zealand, the pugs try to return a large egg before it hatches. When Chloe and Keia lose a special canoe paddle, the pups embark on a wilderness adventure to find it.

programme.title: Puppy Dog Pals
programme.sub-title: Double Doggie Dare!/ Empire State of Mind
programme.desc: When a trip to the Empire State Building is cancelled, Bob signs up for a game show; The pugs want to bring the Empire State Building to Bob.

programme.title: T.O.T.S.
programme.sub-title: The Fastest Flier / Best Friends Wherever
programme.desc: Pip and Freddy teach Ava that there is more to a delivery than speed. When Mia can't say goodbye to her friend, Chloe, the Junior Fliers show her that they can keep in touch!

programme.title: T.O.T.S.
programme.desc: Pip and Freddy deliver a baby Penguin to Pip's hometown. When Pip and Freddy break the conveyor belt at T.O.T.S. they are determined to fix it on their own.

Unfortunately, the ninja don't have enough money to buy the 'Rope of Supreme Durability' and opt instead for the 'Rope of Questionable Integrity'. Even worse, as they are buying the rope, they are spotted by one of Unagami's aerial drones. A squadron of Red Visors quickly arrives and pursues the ninja up the cliffs. The ninja, who only have ropes, must climb while the Red Visors have jet-boots and are able to catch up quickly. During the ensuing battle, Cole is nearly lost, but is saved at the last moment by Kai, who makes a daring leap onto the back of the flying drone and uses the drone to blast the Red Visors. They learn that Unagami is using the energy cubes to build a portal into Ninjago City.

programme.desc: Ree Drummond's putting a breakfast spin on four dinners starting with sensational sausage kale strata, a real make-ahead wonder. Wild rice pancakes get flipped to dinnertime for the girls, while the boys enjoy breakfast quesadillas, packed full of bacon.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: The family is helping out at Ladd's brother's farm, and Ree is packing a cowboy-approved lunch. There's spicy baby back ribs, twice baked potato casserole, and slow cooked jalapeno corn.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: The Drummond family is throwing a farewell dinner for college-bound cousins Paige and Caleb, featuring a spread of their favorite food. Ree Drummond makes two side dishes: brown butter mashed potatoes and roasted cauliflower salad.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman

programme.title: Detroit Steel E7
programme.desc: Adam's pal brings a 1958 Mercury Turnpike Cruiser. Adam must restore it to retain his friend's loyalty. Mobsteel signs a pact with Detroit People Mover.

programme.title: Pawn Stars S20E526
programme.desc: Rick partners up with Rick Dale to prove to Corey that he struck oil with an old Gulf sign. Corey snoops out what might be a Charles Schulz original illustration of the ever-popular Charlie Brown.

programme.title: Storage Wars S11E243
programme.sub-title: Goat Tell It On The Mountain
programme.desc: The buyers try to get away from it all, heading out to Lake Arrowhead, where Ivy puts economies of scale to the test; Justin almost hits the bullseye on his locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars S11E241 !
programme.desc: Once again in Riverside, Shana and Edwina bring their Golden Girls Chic but end up phoning it in; Dave trains his eyes on a messy unit; Rene sells instead of buying.

programme.title: Jesus: His Life E7
programme.desc: Cured of 'seven demons', Mary Magdalene is among Jesus's best-known female disciples. Her faith is tested when she is the first to witness the seemingly unbelievable: His resurrection.

programme.title: Jesus: His Life E8
programme.desc: A simple fisherman, Peter was Jesus' most devoted disciple, his 'rock.' But when a frightened Peter disavows Jesus three times during Jesus' arrest, Peter despairs.

programme.title: History Drama: Six S2E5
programme.desc: The SEALs are sent to rescue hostages; the Prince makes Gina and Michael an offer they struggle to refuse; Caulder begins rehabilitation for a combat injury and meets a similar spirit.

programme.title: History Drama: Six S2E6
programme.desc: The SEALs are put to a difficult test when they receive an order to carry out a prisoner exchange in Chechnya.

programme.title: Car SOS S5E3
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz have taken on a famous German roadster from the 60s, a Mercedes 230SL. The car belongs to petrol head John who bought it as a restoration project. Unfortunately when John suffered a heart attack the task of getting the Mercedes was too much and the iconic was left abandoned. Now Tim and Fuzz have the job of getting this aging motor back on the road but it may turn out to be the worst car they have ever picked up.

programme.title: China Relics Decoded E4
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis is on a journey around China to trace the origins of food. From 7000-year-old rice grains to 4000-year-old noodles and a 2000-year-old irrigation system that's still in use, he discovers how the quest to feed its people has shaped the nation over millennia, and how the same challenges are being met in the nation today.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North Vs South S5E3
programme.desc: As a herd of massive fish hit the waters of North Carolina, the competition heats up between the Northern and Southern fleets. The curse of the Outer Banks strikes again for one of New England's best fisherman. And with the small quota driving up prices, one Northerner takes a gamble to try and nab a monster blue fin, while the smallest boat in the fleet struggles to land their biggest-ever catch.

programme.title: Brain Games S6E3
programme.desc: Actor Anthony Anderson and his younger 'Black-ish' co-star Marsai Martin face off in a series of games with Keegan-Michael Key to explore the surprising differences between adults' and kids' brains. Challenges involve language, reflexes and reaction times, and risk-taking and mind control - all before the two co-stars face off in the Gauntlet's mental obstacle course. Plus, field correspondent Cara Santa Maria pits the driving skills of teens against those of adults by reversing the controls of a go-cart, using neuroscience to explain why one group performs much better than the other.

programme.title: Mega Factories: Supercars E7
programme.desc: The latest versions of the original pony car are built in Ford's Mustang Factory. Amazingly, both the cars and the factory are designed to produce 4 different models, from the base V6 to a 650HP fire breathing V8. In terms of horsepower, the 650HP V8 is the most powerful V8 built anywhere in the world.

programme.title: India's Mega Kitchens S1E5
programme.desc: What does it take to prepare over 10,000 meals a day for discerning clients of the Indian Railways and more? IRCTC shows you how it's done inside one of its central mega kitchens.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North Vs South S5E8
programme.desc: With the small quota running out and top Southern Captain Greg Mayer of the Fishin Frenzy sidelined with injury, Northern and Southern fleets see an opportunity to take the lead. Frenzys mates Billon and Dirty are at the helm of the ship and a battle begins between the rookies and veteran captains for the top-earning spot but first the Bluefin have to bite.

programme.title: The Story Of God With Morgan Freeman S3E2
programme.desc: Morgan Freeman explores the role that the devil plays in various religions. From the ascetic monks in the Judean desert to the Buddhists of Nepal, he'll learn what purpose the figure of the devil serves. Is the devil a force of evil in the world that needs to be conquered? Or is it something that each one of us needs to conquer in our own heart?

programme.title: Notre Dame: Race Against The Inferno
programme.desc: On 15th April 2019, during Holy Monday Mass, the world's most famous cathedral caught fire. Notre-Dame de Paris was ablaze in minutes, as an epic battle unfolded for heroic French firefighters. Under the gaze of the world's media, they fought the inferno for more than 15 hours. Exclusive footage and interviews bring vividly to life the moment-by-moment courage of the Paris fire and police services, as they put their lives on the line to save this historic building.

programme.title: Dictators Rulebook E6
programme.desc: A look at the techniques used by Idi Amin to rise from humble beginnings and build a powerful dictatorship in Uganda. Amin became an expert at deploying military force to achieve political power, a lesson he first learned from the British as a soldier in the colonial army. Through a combination of populist charm and brutal violence, backed up by a vast police state, Idi Amin managed to rule Uganda for eight years.

programme.title: Brain Games S6E8
programme.desc: New Orleans Saints NFL quarterback Drew Brees puts his brain to the test with a series of mental challenges exploring how everyday superhumans have hacked their brains and how we can train our own minds to do as we want. Games include Draft Day, in which Brees tests his reaction time and cognitive flexibility, and a game of hand-eye coordination and perception. Actress Ginnifer Goodwin makes an appearance to give an example of bimanual interference, mentalist Lior Suchard stuns Brees by predicting his every move, and then Brees takes on his own brain strength in the Gauntlet's mental obstacle course.

programme.title: India's Mega Kitchens S2E1
programme.desc: It's the largest gathering of Sikhs. Hola Mohalla celebrated in the city of Anandpur Sahib in Punjab will come alive during the three days around the festival of colour and warrior spirit. Nearly 200 Langars will come up in different parts of the city to cater to over lakhs of people who will gather during the festival. The largest langar will be at Sri Keshgarh Sahib, Takht Gurdwara. The gurudwara that is the birth place of Khalsa. Watch the entire city of Anandpur Sahib turn into a Mega Kitchen.

programme.title: Mega Factories: Supercars E3
programme.desc: The Ferrari factory is building the new FF, the first four-wheel drive Ferrari with four full-sized seats. The FF's 12-cylinder engine is one of the most powerful engines ever built at the factory in Maranello, at 651 Horsepower. The engine block is actually cast there and must go through multiple quality checks before it's ready to join the final assembly line.

programme.title: Saving Notre Dame
programme.desc: In April 2019, a massive fire ripped through the Notre-Dame de Paris, leaving it on the verge of collapse. Long before the last ember was extinguished, the French vowed to rebuild their beloved cathedral that has been the heart of French culture for nearly 900 years. The task at hand is enormous and those challenged with restoration have no idea what they're facing. In this special presentation with exclusive access, we go into the rubble with the heroes who risk their lives to stabilize what's left of Notre-Dame so she can be restored to her former glory.

programme.title: The Story Of God With Morgan Freeman S3E3
programme.desc: Does God speak to us through visions? Can science explain what we call divine inspiration? From indigenous vision quests to healing waters blessed by a Catholic saint, Morgan Freeman meets with people around the world who believe they have received a message from heaven in this latest chapter of the Story of God.

programme.title: Underworld, Inc. S2E2
programme.desc: Increased car security has meant that car criminals are becoming more ingenious than ever. Gangs are working together to steal cars. In Santa Maria, California, three cars are stolen every day. The criminals meanwhile rush to get the cars out of state, and then via corrupt shippers, overseas. In West Africa, a criminal class has arisen willing to pay top dollar for high-end US stolen cars.

programme.title: Mega Factories: Supercars E3
programme.desc: The Ferrari factory is building the new FF, the first four-wheel drive Ferrari with four full-sized seats. The FF's 12-cylinder engine is one of the most powerful engines ever built at the factory in Maranello, at 651 Horsepower. The engine block is actually cast there and must go through multiple quality checks before it's ready to join the final assembly line.

programme.title: The Story Of God With Morgan Freeman S3E3
programme.desc: Does God speak to us through visions? Can science explain what we call divine inspiration? From indigenous vision quests to healing waters blessed by a Catholic saint, Morgan Freeman meets with people around the world who believe they have received a message from heaven in this latest chapter of the Story of God.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North Vs South S5E4
programme.desc: Doghouse fights to land a foul-hooked fish with a Hail Mary Harpoon shot, as the Northern fleet struggles to keep up with the Southern fleet. The Little Shell fishes hard to feed their growing families, and with a storm on the horizon, big risks can have serious consequences. And in a one Bluefin a day fishery, each captain must decide whether to roll the dice in bad weather or head in empty-handed.

programme.title: Brain Games S6E4
programme.desc: Actress Rebel Wilson joins Keegan-Michael Key to explore the power of the subconscious when it comes to falling in love. Games and demos show how facial symmetry, color of clothing, vocal qualities, resemblance to family members and even a guitar case can play a role in attraction. Master mentalist Lior Suchard stuns Wilson by giving her details of a date she remembers - and pairs off potential partners who have a surprising thing in common - before Wilson takes on the Gauntlet, an obstacle course designed to test mental strength and agility.

programme.title: Nazi Megastructures: America's War E4
programme.desc: The extraordinary story of how Japan planned and carried out the surprise air attack on the US Navy in Hawaii. From Admiral Yamamoto's bold idea through months of secret preparation, pilot training, innovations in torpedo design, and clever ruses to deceive US military intelligence, culminating in a devastating strike on America's mighty Pacific Fleet on 7th December 1941.

programme.title: Gok's Chinese Takeaway E4
programme.desc: Gok Wan explores Chinese food influenced by Dutch colonies in Amsterdam in this episode. He starts with the taste of indigenous local food which is called Boerenkool Stampot. A mixture of bacon, vegetables and mashed potatoes produces a fresh flavor for Gok. Then, Gok discovers a feast blended with Dutch, Indonesian, Chinese and Surinamese culture.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North Vs South S5E9
programme.desc: After four uninspired seasons in the Outer Banks, Captain TJ Ott is out to prove he's a contender. Meanwhile Fishin Frenzy fights for the title without their leader as Captain Greg Mayer nurses an injured arm. In a season where the Northern boats are catching more than ever before, Southern boats continue to fish hard against all odds.

programme.title: Locked Up Abroad S8E3
programme.desc: Unemployed Duane Wollum succumbs to the easy money involved in smuggling cocaine so he can support his daughter. With a package strapped to his body on his return to the US from Nicaragua, Duane is stopped for a routine check at the airport. Suddenly, people are diving for cover as Duane is surrounded with several rifles pointed at him.

programme.title: Drain The Oceans S2E12
programme.desc: London is one of the most powerful cities on earth. Draining the Oceans reveals the story of the city's meteoric rise.

programme.title: Lawless Island Alaska Compilations S2E2
programme.desc: Lawless Island's Jack-of-all-trades is as sharp-witted as he is crafty. From his house to the gadgets and gizmos he's constructed along the way, he's found comfort in the wilds of Alaska.

programme.title: Seconds From Disaster Compilation E1
programme.desc: Swiss Air 111 fell from the sky due to microscopic fault in the wiring that sparked a fire in the cockpit. This fire grew uncontrollably and led to the demise of 229 people onboard. JAL123 mysteriously crashed just after takeoff into a remote mountainside. Through thorough investigation, it's learned that wear and tear on small repairs cased the untimely death of the 520 people on board.

programme.title: Gok's Chinese Takeaway E5
programme.desc: Gok Wan sets foot in the country of romance and elegance in this episode. Renowned for its “haute-cuisine”, Paris possesses the essence of world gastronomy. Gok savors the dishes in rustic country-style and admires the fusion of elegance, beauty and simplicity. Also, Gok explores Chinese food in the region, like Ho Fun and rice porridge.

programme.title: Nazi Megastructures: America's War E5
programme.desc: Hitler's final throw of the dice to win World War Two - a surprise, winter attack against the Allies least defended front line - the Ardennes. Spearheaded by SS Panzer Tiger tanks, the Germans try to cut the Allied forces in two and destroy them. The Germans ruthless advance results in the worst war crimes ever committed against Americans. On both sides, thousands are killed but for the Americans, it's the bloodiest battle of the entire war.

programme.title: Drain The Oceans S2E13
programme.desc: Over the last century, a new breed of ocean giant has emerged. Maritime archaeologists and historians go in search of the biggest wrecks ever sunk beneath the seas. New scientific data combines with cutting-edge computer graphics to drain the oceans to investigate the world's most awe-inspiring wrecks.

programme.title: Lawless Island Alaska Compilations S2E3
programme.desc: Hans and Timbis story epitomizes what hard work and community can yield. Their decision to build a community garden and willingness to help friends in their time of need, shed light on Lawless Island accomplishments.

programme.title: Locked Up Abroad S8E5
programme.desc: Tom Hanway takes a trip to South America with a plan to trade 500 hits of LSD for a kilo of cocaine and smuggle it back into California but the deal goes awry. Arrested and sentenced to five years in a Chilean prison, Tom decides to escape with fellow inmate, Chosco. Once out, the pair flees the country on foot, embarking on a fatal journey through the desert with the police in hot pursuit.

programme.title: Nazi Megastructures: America's War E5
programme.desc: Hitler's final throw of the dice to win World War Two - a surprise, winter attack against the Allies least defended front line - the Ardennes. Spearheaded by SS Panzer Tiger tanks, the Germans try to cut the Allied forces in two and destroy them. The Germans ruthless advance results in the worst war crimes ever committed against Americans. New scientific data combines with cutting-edge computer graphics to drain the oceans to investigate the world's most awe-inspiring wrecks.

programme.title: Lawless Island Alaska Compilations S2E3
programme.desc: Hans and Timbis story epitomizes what hard work and community can yield. Their decision to build a community garden and willingness to help friends in their time of need, shed light on Lawless Island accomplishments.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North Vs South S5E5
programme.desc: Bluefin Season in the Outer Banks of North Carolina is a struggle as sustainability imposes stricter limits on fishing. Northern tuna fisherman who followed the migration are blamed by Southern captains for siphoning their livelihood hurdling the competition into maximum overdrive in a race to catch the prized blue gold.

programme.title: Brain Games S6E5
programme.desc: Actors and married couple Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard go head-to-head in the Battle of the Sexes, a series of games designed to find out how men's and women's brains differ. Challenges include stocking items in a fridge, communicating the details of a model's outfit and solving a math puzzle before a gas balloon explodes. Field correspondent Cara Santa Maria plays a game of telephone with a group in Los Angeles to see if men or women communicate better, and mentalist Lior Suchard astonishingly reveals the names of Bell and Shepard's first crushes, all culminating in the Gauntlet, a battle where the two compare their mental strength and agility.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar E4
programme.desc: Ralph and his 2 teams build scrap cars to take on Shane's Chevrolet Camaro in a plane-pulling contest.

programme.title: Japan: Between Earth And Sky E3
programme.desc: Japan is an archipelago of immeasurable natural wealth. The large southern islands, Shikoku, Kyushu and Okinawa, with their relaxed atmosphere, are the cradle of Japanese spirituality. Amid spectacular landscapes, this journey between sea and sky to discover the mystical and wild islands of the South will reveal the face of a secret Japan.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North Vs South S5E10
programme.desc: It's the toughest Carolina Bluefin Season yet and with half of the quota caught and time running out, every boat on the water is out for blood. Injured Captain Greg Mayer is returning to reclaim the lead after his mates fell into 2nd place but he's in for an uphill battle with his closest rivals: Northern boat Hot Tuna and Southern vessel Little Shell.

programme.title: Airport Security: Peru E10
programme.desc: On this episode, agents of the Antinarcotics Division at the Jorge Chavez International Airport in Lima, Peru, are witnesses of a love betrayal. Officers detain a couple and find bottles of contaminated purple chicha in each of their suitcases. But the real shock comes during interrogation, as the boyfriend claims to be the sole perpetrator of this drug smuggling attempt, and confesses that he had brought his girlfriend to Peru under false pretenses. Then, a young man attempts to smuggle cocaine in food packages, while another young passenger carefully conceals narcotics in his clothes and a false bottom. Agents also inspect a package of hand-made garments that cannot be as harmless as it seems.

programme.title: Deadly Drops E1
programme.desc: DEADLY DROPS: EATEN BY AN ESCALATOR looks at the terrifying moments when these everyday machines suddenly cause chaos. Footage shows escalators spiraling out of control, of people being trapped, and even swallowed alive.

programme.title: Live Free Or Die S3E6
programme.desc: Frontiersman Colbert sets up a trotline to catch fish while he works on his cabin. With spring quickly approaching, time is critical to get his cabin built before the mosquitoes arrive. While having Delia by his side has many advantages, it also means that woodsman Thorn needs to secure twice as many resources to survive.

programme.title: Seconds From Disaster Compilation E2
programme.desc: Chinhook HC-2 crashed into a hill on the west side of the Mull of Kintyre in Scotland after taking a group of VIP passengers from Northern Ireland to Fort George. The following day would bring a mysterious crash that remains unsolved. When a US Black Hawk falls on the streets of Mogadishu, all hell breaks loose.

programme.title: The Witch Doctor Will See You Now E1
programme.desc: Author and explorer Piers Gibbon travels to Hong Kong to try to uncover the science and secrets behind traditional Chinese medicine. He is joined by two volunteer patients: a transplant survivor and a biker suffering from chronic back pain as they experience a range of unusual treatments. Their goal is to find a cure to their medical ailments that Western medicine has been unable to provide.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar E5
programme.desc: Ralph and his two teams build vehicles out of scrap to take on Shane's Lamborghini Huracan Performante in a timed-lap showdown.

programme.title: Deadly Drops E2
programme.desc: DEADLY DROPS: TRAPPED IN AN ELEVATOR takes us into the fascinating world of lifts and the looks at terrifying moments when these everyday machines suddenly cause chaos. Capable of taking people captive, trapping passengers in doors and suddenly plummeting down shafts, this film meets some of the people who have been most badly affected by lift malfunctions.

programme.title: Live Free Or Die S3E7
programme.desc: Thorn goes on a nutria hunt hoping to provide protein that Delia and he need to survive, Tony and Amelia take a big step in their homesteading journey and attempt to sell goods at market in town, Colbert is in the midst of a natural disaster as rising waters put his new cabin construction at risk, and Matt goes on a turkey hunt in the canyons he now calls home.

programme.title: Airport Security: Peru E11
programme.desc: On this episode, agents of the Antinarcotics Division at the Jorge Chavez International Airport, in Lima, Peru, encounter language barriers when they detain two Ukrainian passengers smuggling drugs in their luggage. In the meantime, a couple is arrested as officers find narcotics in four pieces of luggage, although the passengers deny any involvement. At the loading docks, a shipment containing eight winter hats raises the suspicions of the officers, who quickly discover cloths impregnated with cocaine inside the hats. In another operation, a young man seems to be unaware that he has committed a crime, as the amount of marihuana he is carrying for his personal consumption is over 30 times more than the legal amount permitted by law.

programme.title: Gourmet Goes Tribal E18
programme.desc: Fermentation, Alcohol & beverages: Human migration led to the spread of amazing practices in many parts of the world. People migrated with the treasure of these practices and shared them with other races. Pablo learned more about this diverse country India as he dug through the practices in North East brought by people from countries like Tibet, Burma, Laos, Vietnam.

programme.title: Fish Of The Day S3E3
programme.desc: Clarke travels to Aitutaki and catches up with Bonefish guide Etu, to catch one of the most challenging fish in the World to catch on Fly, the Bonefish. Along the way he catches up with the Prime Minister of the Cook Islands, also a keen fisherman and they head out to track down one of his favourite local fish the Kuta, for local Chef Thomas.

programme.title: Fish Of The Day S3E4
programme.desc: Clarke enjoys a proper adventure off the East Coast of New Zealand taking a boat out to White Island, a very active volcano 50kms offhsore. Here conditions can quickly change. Catching his target fish after plenty of false alarms, Clarke takes it back to chef Josh in the local town of Whakatane. Josh specialises in celiac friendly quisine and his Hapuku dish does not dissapoint.

programme.title: Places We Go S8E1
programme.desc: Jen discovers the incredible treasures of Cambodia including Angkor Wat as well as meeting the most interesting locals.

programme.title: Route Awakening S3E2
programme.desc: Dr Jonathan Clements, historian, author and TV host, continues his exploration of the Dong tribe and visits a village considered the living fossil of ancient traditions where he learns folk crafts from the elderly and witnesses an elaborate Dong style funeral.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay: Uncharted S1E3
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay travels down the Mekong River in Laos, Southeast Asia on an adventure to unlock the secrets of its cuisine.

programme.title: My Pacific Quest E4
programme.desc: Host Ellis Emmett has his first brush with royalty on the island kingdoms of Wallis & Futuna. But it is the life of a lone man, living simply on a remote island, which truly captures Ellis' imagination. Ever the adventurer, Ellis dives into a lake that, according to local legend, is full of mysteries and monsters.

programme.title: Ugly House To Lovely House With George Clarke S2E1
programme.desc: In stunning rural Gloucestershire Simon and Lisa recently bought a carbuncle on the landscape. Originally built in the Dutch barn style this shoddy building was such a nightmare that neighbours compared it to the house in Amityville Horror. Simon hated it so much that he wanted to bulldoze it and start again. George teams the couple up with creative architect Laura Clark. Her challenge is to come up with a scheme to turn this terrifying building into a warm, welcoming, modern home, whilst still retaining some of its character. But with a limited budget and only 9 weeks to play with, Simon and Lisa may have to get their hands dirty if they want to achieve their dream.

programme.title: John Torode's Asia E2
programme.desc: John Torode is in the holy city of Amritsar in the Punjab region of northern India. His first outing takes him to the Golden Temple. What's remarkable about this site besides the temple itself is that it provides free meals to as many as 100,000 people per day, regardless of religion, colour or wealth.

programme.title: San Diego: More To Explore E3
programme.desc: San Diego is known for being on the cutting edge of scientific discovery. Whether that means saving an entire species from near extinction, to pushing the envelope on fine dining and rethinking how we utilize food. Host Robert Reid explores San Diego's smart advancements in technology and the inventive minds behind them.

programme.title: Hakka Renaissance E2
programme.desc: Historian anthropologist Julian Davison is teaming up with Natalie Pickles, host and model of British and Taiwanese descent, to explore and understand the relationship of Hakka food and their traditional lifestyle. The unlikely duo traverse across Taiwan's north-western hinterlands, along a 150 km stretch of highway known as the Romantic Route 3. Along the way, Julian and Natalie meet unique characters and learn that the heart of Hakka cuisine stemmed from their traditional way of living.

programme.title: Gourmet Goes Tribal E18
programme.desc: Fermentation, Alcohol & beverages: Human migration led to the spread of amazing practices in many parts of the world. People migrated with the treasure of these practices and shared them with other races. Pablo learned more about this diverse country India as he dug through the practices in North East brought by people from countries like Tibet, Burma, Laos, Vietnam.

programme.title: Fish Of The Day S3E3
programme.desc: Clarke travels to Aitutaki and catches up with Bonefish guide Etu, to catch one of the most challenging fish in the World to catch on Fly, the Bonefish. Along the way he catches up with the Prime Minister of the Cook Islands, also a keen fisherman and they head out to track down one of his favourite local fish the Kuta, for local Chef Thomas.

programme.title: Fish Of The Day S3E4
programme.desc: Clarke enjoys a proper adventure off the East Coast of New Zealand taking a boat out to White Island, a very active volcano 50kms offhsore. Here conditions can quickly change. Catching his target fish after plenty of false alarms, Clarke takes it back to chef Josh in the local town of Whakatane. Josh specialises in celiac friendly quisine and his Hapuku dish does not dissapoint.

programme.title: Places We Go S8E1
programme.desc: Jen discovers the incredible treasures of Cambodia including Angkor Wat as well as meeting the most interesting locals.

programme.title: Route Awakening S3E2
programme.desc: Dr Jonathan Clements, historian, author and TV host, continues his exploration of the Dong tribe and visits a village considered the living fossil of ancient traditions where he learns folk crafts from the elderly and witnesses an elaborate Dong style funeral.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay: Uncharted S1E3
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay travels down the Mekong River in Laos, Southeast Asia on an adventure to unlock the secrets of its cuisine.

programme.title: My Pacific Quest E4
programme.desc: Host Ellis Emmett has his first brush with royalty on the island kingdoms of Wallis & Futuna. But it is the life of a lone man, living simply on a remote island, which truly captures Ellis' imagination. Ever the adventurer, Ellis dives into a lake that, according to local legend, is full of mysteries and monsters.

programme.title: Ugly House To Lovely House With George Clarke S2E2
programme.desc: There are ugly houses, and then there is Nick and Sonia's house; an appallingly designed afterthought that is essentially a flat over three dysfunctional car parking spaces. George charges award winning architects Abigail Ashton and Andrew Porter with creating something beautiful from this monstrosity. Together they have built their reputation on creating extraordinary, innovative homes in the most suburban of settings, but working with a budget of £75K can they transform this foul flat into a proper home with two floors? And what will the neighbours on their 90's estate make of the changes?

programme.title: John Torode's Asia E3
programme.desc: As a lifelong lover of Chinese food, when John Torode's tour of Asian cuisine stops off in Beijing, he is understandably elated. Naturally John heads straight to a Beijing's most loved Peking Duck restaurant in the heart of the Hutongs and is fascinated to see and then taste a traditionally inflated and roasted Peking Duck.

programme.title: San Diego: More To Explore E4
programme.desc: In addition to its world-renowned beaches and an endless supply of sunshine, San Diego is also home to a thriving art scene. From actors and chefs to architects and designers - Host and National Geographic Traveler writer, Robert Reid, discovers the limitless palette of inspiration San Diego has to offer.

programme.title: Hakka Renaissance E3
programme.desc: Historian anthropologist Julian Davison and host-model Natalie Pickles dive head in to Hakka culture by joining a Hakka Opera troupe on stage as they conclude their journey on the Taiwan Romantic Route 3. To get their performance up to scratch, our unlikely duo must first understand the basics of Hakka culture. The pair meet Professor Zheng Rom Shing to understand how Hakka opera's roots began with tea picking, before taking pronunciation lessons with a group of elementary school children. Hakka arts revolves around the environment and community.

programme.title: Gourmet Goes Tribal E19
programme.desc: Food has always been a way to spread joy and happiness for Pablo. When he got a chance to return the favour, Pablo couldn't think of a better way than to cook for the people of North East and share the magic of food with them. Pablo talks about his most innovative dishes given the limited amount of time and unusual ingredients, he churned out some amazing recipes in the North East of India.

programme.title: Fish Of The Day S3E5
programme.desc: Clarke has a good look at one of the most productive harbours in New Zealand. Home to over 20% of the world's seabird biodiversity and with a resident whale population, this unique location is an incredible harbinger of life. Clarke explores some of the harbours hidden features and shows a fishing club that has made big changes to better utilize the ocean around it.

programme.title: Fish Of The Day S3E6
programme.desc: Chasing a Dog Tooth Tuna, Clarke encounters everything but as he tackles the waters off Apia Island, Samoa. Not that he has any complaints as he manages to hook the largest Giant Trevally he has ever captured. He also gets in the water to discover that Samoa has some incredible spearfishing in the warm clear tropical waters that surround it.

programme.title: Places We Go S8E2
programme.desc: Clint flies in by sea plane to view the Grizzly Bears up close and also gets his hands dirty at Echo Valley Ranch in British Columbia.

programme.title: Route Awakening S3E3
programme.desc: Dr Jonathan Clements, historian, author and TV host, meets a small community of Gorlos Mongols in the northern province of Jilin who keep their culture alive through Shamanistic practices and music including a unique style called throat singing.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay: Uncharted S1E4
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to the remote corners of New Zealand's South Island on an adventure to discover the secrets of Maori cuisine.

programme.title: My Pacific Quest E5
programme.desc: After exploring WWII wrecks still stuck in the sand throughout the Marshall Islands, adventurer Ellis Emmett seeks to understand the fallout from the atomic history of this isolated part of the world. With locals fuelling his thirst for understanding, Ellis dives into the depths of the infamous Bikini Atoll then stands atop a radioactive island.

programme.title: Ugly House To Lovely House With George Clarke S2E2
programme.desc: There are ugly houses, and then there is Nick and Sonia's house; an appallingly designed afterthought that is essentially a flat over three dysfunctional car parking spaces. programme.title: Gordon Ramsay: Uncharted S1E4
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to the remote corners of New Zealand's South Island on an adventure to discover the secrets of Maori cuisine.

programme.title: My Pacific Quest E5
programme.desc: After exploring WWII wrecks still stuck in the sand throughout the Marshall Islands, adventurer Ellis Emmett seeks to understand the fallout from the atomic history of this isolated part of the world. With locals fuelling his thirst for understanding, Ellis dives into the depths of the infamous Bikini Atoll then stands atop a radioactive island.

programme.title: Pond Stars E1
programme.desc: In the season opener, Greg and the crew work to install a giant pond for Tony and Shari, who want a larger home for their koi fish. Meanwhile, a client calls Greg to fix her current pond, but instead of fixing it, Greg transforms the bland backyard into a wild sanctuary. Working on their best to turn two backyards into entirely new ecosystems, the team races to get both projects done.

programme.title: Pond Stars E2
programme.desc: After long hours, some close calls and way too much grunt work, the new guy Chris is tasked to lead a complete backyard makeover for his own company's Marketing Manager, Tony, and he's ready to prove he can make the grade in the pond business. Meanwhile, Ed and Greg take a field trip to a nearby high school to construct a courtyard pond to be used as a perfect outdoor classroom.

programme.title: Island Hunter E2
programme.desc: An uncommon destination for a series that explores exotic tropical getaways. But this island nation has some of the most evocative landscapes that mother nature has to offer! And, host Liesel Hlista explores the charms of the emerald state in it's off-season. Questionable weather is no match for the bounty of eats and drinks that Ireland has on offer; the best oysters this side of the Atlantic, the birthplace of Guinness and of course, the home to Irish whiskey. Liesel explores ultra luxurious (and famous) celebrity getaways like Castle Leslie, goes hands on at the Dunbrody house with celebrity chef Kevin Dundon, and explores the Wild Atlantic way at the fishing estate Ballynahinch Castle. The best way to explore Ireland in the off-season, Island Hunter style!

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce India S2E6
programme.desc: The historic region of Fort Kochi boasts an unexpected blend of cultural influences of Chinese, Indian, Portuguese and British. It also happens to be one of the only places in India where you can eat beef. David goes on a hunt for good stuff, enjoying chili fried and dry-fried beef. He meets up with Chef Ajeeth of the famed Brunton Boatyard to continue the beef-themed adventure at his restaurant.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce India S2E7
programme.desc: The beautiful Chinese fishing nets are iconic tourist attractions along the coast of Kochi and David discovers that the fishermen who operate them are just as intriguing. In a true cultural exchange, they teach David how to work the nets while David cooks their catch of the day for them. Later, David visits the idyllic Kayal island retreat where the women workers catch fish using only their hands.

programme.title: Confucius Was A Foodie S3E2
programme.desc: Chinese cuisines use sugar very differently from Western cuisines, and Christine starts her comparison in Paris and Athens where she looks at how Westerners interpret ‘sweet'. Traditionally, for the Chinese, sugar is predominantly used to achieve balance, but the liberal use of sugars in South East Asia Chinese cuisines are a culinary surprise.

programme.title: Around The World In 80 Dishes E3
programme.desc: Manu takes a short flight to Mumbai and for the first time in his life, he is in India. A feast for the senses, he wants to discover as much food as he can handle. He is referred to a local Idli maker in Dharavi, who agrees to teach him the craft of Idli-making. But language isn't the only barrier for Manu as he discovers the craziness of Dharavi and its people.

programme.title: Ugly House To Lovely House With George Clarke S2E1
programme.desc: In stunning rural Gloucestershire Simon and Lisa recently bought a carbuncle on the landscape. programme.title: Ugly House To Lovely House With George Clarke S2E1
programme.desc: In stunning rural Gloucestershire Simon and Lisa recently bought a carbuncle on the landscape. Originally built in the Dutch barn style this shoddy building was such a nightmare that neighbours compared it to the house in Amityville Horror. Simon hated it so much that he wanted to bulldoze it and start again. George teams the couple up with creative architect Laura Clark. Her challenge is to come up with a scheme to turn this terrifying building into a warm, welcoming, modern home, whilst still retaining some of its character. But with a limited budget and only 9 weeks to play with, Simon and Lisa may have to get their hands dirty if they want to achieve their dream.

programme.title: Pond Stars E3
programme.desc: The Pond Stars head to the world-renowned Lincoln Park Zoo in downtown Chicago for two massive projects. First they come up with a solution to the Red Wolf exhibit whose pond has never functioned properly. While that's going on they also have a small rehab job to do on a water feature at the bird exhibit. What makes matters even harder is the Pond Stars have only 4 days to get it all done.

programme.title: Pond Stars E4
programme.desc: Greg and the team head to the sunshine state for two massive pond projects outside of Jacksonville, Florida. This first is to build one of the team's most challenging designs by completing a 30-foot pond and a 2,000-pound cypress bench. The Pond Stars then have to race the clock to design and install a new pond, patio and pergola in less than 48 hours.

programme.title: Island Hunter E3
programme.desc: Easy island vibes, lots of amazing local rum, brilliant natural landscapes and those amazing beaches! Of course, Island Hunter is in Jamaica! But in this episode, host Liesel Hlista shows you a different side of the Irie nation; away from the hordes of people unleashed via cruise liners! She starts off with a quick glimpse and an impromptu jam session at the birthplace of Bob Marley, Trench town, noshes on the most delicious ice cream this side of the hemisphere, and plunges into Mystic mountain's waterfalls. Jamaica is known for being the home of the all-inclusive resort and Liesel finds out exactly why that is - with stays at Ian Fleming inspired Golden eye Hotel as well as Sunset at the Palms! Lazy tubing down the river, limestone foot massages, topped up with historic food tours and experiencing local cuisines such as jerk chicken and the amazing seafood; this is Jamaica, Island Hunter style!

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce India S2E8
programme.desc: David explores Kolkata, a city so rich in culture and food tradition. He meets up with Myanck, a local chef from ITC, to check out the city's fish market. Later, they head into the kitchen with their fish-market finds and experiment with Kolkata's two signature ingredients: mustard and fresh river fish, and everyone agrees the results are delicious.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce India S2E9
programme.desc: The people of Kolkata are so intensely proud of their local cuisine, especially their epic street food. David meets up with Sneha, who takes him on a crazy food tour of the city. They ride the tram and do as the locals do on their quest to sample Kolkata's best street eats, including the famous Kati roll.

programme.title: Confucius Was A Foodie S3E3
programme.desc: According to science humans are the only mammals that are attracted to sour. Chinese medicinal believes says that ‘sour' can help digestion and whet the appetite. In traditional Chinese cuisines it is often used for balance but in south East Asian versions of Chinese dishes it is often quite forward even becoming part of the name of a dish particularly in traditional Peranakan Chinese cuisines.

programme.title: Around The World In 80 Dishes E4
programme.desc: The flight from Kolkata to Hong Kong was a long and exhausting one and although it's chewed into his budget, Manu can't resist the allure of a Michelin-starred restaurant in his hotel.

programme.title: Ugly House To Lovely House With George Clarke S2E2

programme.title: Cruise Ship Diaries S1E6
programme.desc: This is the final cruise for Captain Russo and he must have the Costa Serena in perfect running order before the handover to a new captain. There is also a new itinerary and a week of intensive safety tests keeping the crew busy before he disembarks. With a new route comes a change in the entertainment schedule as well. Preparations are in full swing for the final voyage of the season.

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces S8E1
programme.desc: George travels to Suffolk to meet Simon who wants to thank his mum Carole by converting a railway cattle carriage into a luxury mobile holiday home fit for a queen. George also meets Claire in East London who, having bought her dream vintage Morris Minor Caravanette discovers it's actually rotten to the core.

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita Coastal Kitchen S2E5
programme.desc: Peter indulges his passion for seafood by diving for abalone, cooking up some local crayfish and curing trout with a delicious Margaret River gin.

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita Coastal Kitchen S2E6
programme.desc: Peter completes his tour of Margaret River hosting a spectacular Beachside BBQ as part of the Gourmet Escape.

programme.title: Climbing The Property Ladder E2
programme.desc: Meet best friends Chris and Liz who have pooled their pension pots and bought their first renovation project in Preston. They aim to make a £19,000 profit in just four weeks, but with their schedule slipping, have they taken on more than they bargained for?

programme.title: Pond Stars E3
programme.desc: The Pond Stars head to the world-renowned Lincoln Park Zoo in downtown Chicago for two massive projects. programme.title: What's For Sale With A View S2E1
programme.desc: Simon dreams of waking up to a peaceful view, looking out over a still lake in perfect silence. A place to escape the constant hustle and noise of life as a busy developer where he and his kids are the only ones on their very own private lake.

programme.title: Places We Go S8E1
programme.desc: Jen discovers the incredible treasures of Cambodia including Angkor Wat as well as meeting the most interesting locals.

Preparations are in full swing for the final voyage of the season.

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces S8E1
programme.desc: George travels to Suffolk to meet Simon who wants to thank his mum Carole by converting a railway cattle carriage into a luxury mobile holiday home fit for a queen. George also meets Claire in East London who, having bought her dream vintage Morris Minor Caravanette discovers it's actually rotten to the core.

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita Coastal Kitchen S2E5
programme.desc: Peter indulges his passion for seafood by diving for abalone, cooking up some local crayfish and curing trout with a delicious Margaret River gin.

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita Coastal Kitchen S2E6
programme.desc: Peter completes his tour of Margaret River hosting a spectacular Beachside BBQ as part of the Gourmet Escape.

programme.title: Climbing The Property Ladder E2
programme.desc: Meet best friends Chris and Liz who have pooled their pension pots and bought their first renovation project in Preston. They aim to make a £19,000 profit in just four weeks, but with their schedule slipping, have they taken on more than they bargained for?

programme.title: Pond Stars E3
programme.desc: The Pond Stars head to the world-renowned Lincoln Park Zoo in downtown Chicago for two massive projects. First they come up with a solution to the Red Wolf exhibit whose pond has never functioned properly. While that's going on they also have a small rehab job to do on a water feature at the bird exhibit. What makes matters even harder is the Pond Stars have only 4 days to get it all done.

programme.title: Pond Stars E4
programme.desc: Greg and the team head to the sunshine state for two massive pond projects outside of Jacksonville, Florida. This first is to build one of the team's most challenging designs by completing a 30-foot pond and a 2,000-pound cypress bench. The Pond Stars then have to race the clock to design and install a new pond, patio and pergola in less than 48 hours.

programme.title: What's For Sale With A View S2E1
programme.desc: Simon dreams of waking up to a peaceful view, looking out over a still lake in perfect silence. A place to escape the constant hustle and noise of life as a busy developer where he and his kids are the only ones on their very own private lake.

programme.title: Places We Go S8E1
programme.desc: Jen discovers the incredible treasures of Cambodia including Angkor Wat as well as meeting the most interesting locals.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce India S2E6
programme.desc: The historic region of Fort Kochi boasts an unexpected blend of cultural influences of Chinese, Indian, Portuguese and British. It also happens to be one of the only places in India where you can eat beef. David goes on a hunt for good stuff, enjoying chili fried and dry-fried beef. He meets up with Chef Ajeeth of the famed Brunton Boatyard to continue the beef-themed adventure at his restaurant.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce India S2E7
programme.desc: The beautiful Chinese fishing nets are iconic tourist attractions along the coast of Kochi and David discovers that the fishermen who operate them are just as intriguing. In a true cultural exchange, they teach David how to work the nets while David cooks their catch of the day for them. Later, David visits the idyllic Kayal island retreat where the women workers catch fish using only their hands.

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces S8E2
programme.desc: George travels to Cornwall to meet Rebecca and Damian, a young couple who are trading in their house for a debt free life in a cool, luxury American trailer known as a Silver Streak. But with just £10 grand to finish the job can they transform this trailer from trash to vintage treasure?

programme.title: Shandong: Land Of Confucius
programme.desc: Shandong Province is home to China's most famous philosopher- Confucius, Jonathan Clements as a historian and expert on Asian Culture, will be the host of this show. In the course of a whirlwind adventure that spans 9 carefully chosen locations throughout Shandong, Clements, a scholar of modern Asian trends gives us his fascinating take on how China got where it is today.

programme.title: Climbing The Property Ladder E3
programme.desc: First time property developer Cate and her fiancee Nikki are looking to boost their pension pot and they carry out a high risk strategy by pouring all of Cate's life savings into a rundown house they don't even own. Will her dream of making a £200,000 profit turn into a nightmare?

programme.title: Inside T4: Terminal Of Tomorrow
programme.desc: In 2017, Changi Airport served a new high 62 million passengers. By 2030, it plans to bring its capacity to more 150 million passengers. The first step to this expansion is the opening of its new terminal - T4. With the annual world's Best Airport title up for review, Changi is pulling all the stops to elevate the flight experience from the moment a passenger steps into the terminal through the combination of nature, art and technology. From cutting-edge facial recognition technology to 12-metre-tall indoor trees and one the world's largest kinetic sculptures, we reveal how the team behind Changi Airport fuses innovative design and fully automated technological solutions to provide the airport experience Changi is world-renowned for.

programme.title: Easyjet: Inside The Cockpit S1E1
programme.desc: EasyJet, the UK's biggest airline, launched its largest ever pilot recruitment drive including a focus on encouraging more women to apply for this career where females currently make only three per cent of pilots worldwide. Becoming a pilot involves dedication and determination and the trainees come from every walk of life. But does the reality live up to the dream of flying high?

programme.title: What's For Sale With A View S2E2
programme.desc: Michelle and Justin are outdoor enthusiasts and every spare moment is planned around kite surfing and paddle boarding trips. It's time for them to find their very own long beach view.

programme.title: Places We Go S8E2
programme.desc: Clint flies in by sea plane to view the Grizzly Bears up close and also gets his hands dirty at Echo Valley Ranch in British Columbia.

programme.title: Fish Tank Kings S1E2
programme.desc: Leaving Ben in charge of the warehouse, Mat takes off to the Caribbean island of Curacao with Allan Marshall, who runs biological operations at the Florida Aquarium, to locate some deep sea fish for a new exhibit. Meanwhile, the guys in the warehouse are stretched to the limit as Mat has promised a repeat client a 3000-gallon aquarium in just three weeks!

programme.title: World's Deadliest S2E8
programme.desc: What's hungrier than a predator? The underdog that fights back. Even the king of the jungle can be a victim in the wild. Watch as aggressive cape buffaloes toss a lion like a rag doll, a gazelle gets loose from a cheetah's grip and charges at him, and a tiger shark looking for food becomes food for orcas. The only hierarchy in the animal kingdom that matters is the survival of the fittest.

programme.title: Snakes In The City S3E6
programme.desc: Snake catcher Simon Keys and Siouxsie Gillett's business poses life and death situations. Every capture of pythons has its dangers, from an almost fatal mamba attack to the risks of being buried under a collapsing house with a snake. They conquer their fear and cope with one the world's deadliest creatures.

programme.title: Lion Kingdom E1
programme.desc: The Glade is a paradise in the desiccated plains of Ruaha. Water is here all year round. This bounty spawns strange relationships, like the pact that exists between a baboon and a lion family who, against all natural instincts, live in harmony. But peace in the Glade is shattered when thousands of buffalo arrive to drink. They are followed by the biggest pride in all of Ruaha National Park, The Baobab pride. While the Baobab pride hunts the herd inside the Glade, another pride arrives on the scene. They are the Njaa - a pride of drifters - always following the buffalo herd.

programme.title: Fish Tank Kings S1E2
programme.desc: Leaving Ben in charge of the warehouse, Mat takes off to the Caribbean island of Curacao with Allan Marshall, who runs biological operations at the Florida Aquarium, to locate some deep sea fish for a new exhibit. Meanwhile, the guys in the warehouse are stretched to the limit as Mat has promised a repeat client a 3000-gallon aquarium in just three weeks!

programme.title: World's Deadliest S2E8

They conquer their fear and cope with one the world's deadliest creatures.

programme.title: Lion Kingdom E1

But peace in the Glade is shattered when thousands of buffalo arrive to drink. They are followed by the biggest pride in all of Ruaha National Park, The Baobab pride. While the Baobab pride hunts the herd inside the Glade, another pride arrives on the scene. They are the Njaa - a pride of drifters - always following the buffalo herd.

programme.title: Dead By Dawn Compilations E1
programme.desc: Around the world, nighttime is a time of terror. In Indonesia, a bat struggles to climb past a vanguard of vipers to reach the safety of her colony. In Southern India, a mother bandicoot rat must outswim a cobra and crocodiles to find food for her babies. And in the rainforests of Costa Rica, darkness means a deadly free-for-all. Who will survive the horrors of night long enough to see the day, and who will be dead by dawn?

programme.title: Hooked S5E2
programme.desc: An angler is yanked overboard by a ten-foot blue shark, a fisherman dodges a flying marlin that misses him by a fraction of an inch, and two daring spear fishermen dive in shark-infested waters on a quest for a scientific breakthrough. We'll travel to one of the most remote fishing grounds on Earth for death-defying confrontations of man and beast.

programme.title: Pond Stars E6
programme.desc: The Pond Stars come out of their shell in Atlanta tackling two wild projects in just five days. Their first job is at an environmental center, creating a pond specifically for rescued turtles as an outdoor classroom for an upcoming kids camp. The second project is to build a 35-foot waterfall and 600-gallon reservoir that will have wildlife flocking to this suburban backyard, for the birds.

programme.title: Animal Fight Club S3E5
programme.desc: In a race to beat the big freeze, caribou migrate south to look for mates, but still find time to go head-to-head with their deadly headgear, fighting for rights to the bloodline. In Yellowstone National Park, a badger finds some tasty red fox cubs for brunch but meets their dad, who is willing to fight to the bitter end to protect his babies.

programme.title: Operation Sumatran Rhino
programme.desc: In Borneo, Sumatran rhinos' numbers are down to just single digits, and conservationists are on a desperate mission to save the country's last ones. However, capturing all remaining rhinos in the wild is costly and dangerous. Follow Malaysia's foremost rhino scientists on their incredible quest to breed a future generation and to save this critically endangered species.

programme.title: Lion Kingdom E2
programme.desc: The Glade is a paradise where there is always water, a place where strange things happen. As the dry continues in Ruaha, herds of elephants arrive in the Glade. They dig deep into the sand with their trunks to tap the cleanest waters. The Glade pride copy the elephants - unusual behavior, but not in the Glade. Life carries on in its idiosyncratic way, but soon things may change. Adult male lions are on the horizon, they're following the buffalo. The Njaa pride have already spotted the males. The Njaa are drifters, they consider the buffalo their territory. But even these fearless lionesses will not hunt while the lions are about - and now the males are on their way to the Glade.

programme.title: Dead By Dawn Compilations E2
programme.desc: Around the world, when the sun goes down, deadly dangers emerge. In the Arabian Desert, a gecko realizes he's not alone when the sand beneath his feet starts shifting. In Southern India, a praying mantis prays as an army of weaver ants march toward his arms and legs. In the African wilderness, a lion cub cries for his mother while a hyena gets closer, and closer. Who will survive the horrors of tonight, and who will be dead by dawn?

programme.title: Operation Sumatran Rhino
programme.desc: In Borneo, Sumatran rhinos' numbers are down to just single digits, and conservationists are on a desperate mission to save the country's last ones. However, capturing all remaining rhinos in the wild is costly and dangerous. Follow Malaysia's foremost rhino scientists on their incredible quest to breed a future generation and to save this critically endangered species.

However, capturing all remaining rhinos in the wild is costly and dangerous. Follow Malaysia's foremost rhino scientists on their incredible quest to breed a future generation and to save this critically endangered species.

programme.title: Fish Tank Kings S2E3
programme.desc: The team has been commissioned to revive a showcase aquarium. They must recreate a sea turtle's natural habitat, however, the tank's marine life including sharks and stingrays, cannot be removed from the premises so someone will have to swim with the carnivores. Next, one tough client wants three tanks in one, completed in a fraction of the time the crew allots for such complex projects.

programme.title: Animal Fight Club S3E1
programme.desc: See what happens when the animal kingdom's biggest and craziest fighters go head-to-head. There's a fight between lionesses and a leopard in an African big cat showdown, and two brown bears battle it out for a prime salmon-fishing spot on an Alaskan river. In the deadly Sahara Desert, an infamous honey badger takes on two jackals to protect her son.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol S5E2
programme.desc: The Isabella County Fair is just around the corner - which means Dr. Pol, Dr. Emily and Dr. Brenda are busy treating fair animals, making sure they are in tiptop shape for competition. Dr. Pol and Charles start the day tending to a fair pig, whose future isn't looking so fair after all. Will Dr. Pol be able to get this prolapsed show pig back in shape? Across town, Dr. Emily's up to bat, with a cow named Toro - who's abdominal hernia seems to be more than a hiccup on the road to winning the blue ribbon. Now it's Dr. Brenda's turn - there are two horn-y things on the heads of steers, Big Ron and Hannah, preventing them from getting fair-side. When the gates open and the animals come rolling in - Doc Pol's the man the Isabella County Fair looks to, to make sure all of the 4H animals are healthy and ready to show. But just because Dr. Pol works at the fair, doesn't mean he can't have a little fun at the fair too!

programme.title: Unlikely Animal Friends S4E6
programme.desc: Dogs are the main characters featured in this episode. You'll see a cheetah who's friends with a Rhodesian Ridgeback, and a couple of Dalmatians who're cuddle partners with a cat, and another unlikely friendship between a human and an animal: a Floridian veterinarian who's friends with a pig.

programme.title: Fish Tank Kings S2E3
programme.desc: The team has been commissioned to revive a showcase aquarium. They must recreate a sea turtle's natural habitat, however, the tank's marine life including sharks and stingrays, cannot be removed from the premises so someone will have to swim with the carnivores. Next, one tough client wants three tanks in one, completed in a fraction of the time the crew allots for such complex projects.

programme.title: Unlikely Animal Friends S4E6
programme.desc: Dogs are the main characters featured in this episode. You'll see a cheetah who's friends with a Rhodesian Ridgeback, and a couple of Dalmatians who're cuddle partners with a cat, and another unlikely friendship between a human and an animal: a Floridian veterinarian who's friends with a pig.

programme.title: Wild Cats Of India E1
programme.desc: India's big cats remain the soul of the Indian terrain - acting as charismatic ambassadors for the protection of their ecosystems. In Episode 1, watch the snow leopard guard his kill from an unrelenting red fox and follow the lives of the last surviving Asiatic lions of Gir. Using the latest camera technology, the lives of these Big Cats have been brought to our very homes in Episode 1!

programme.title: Japan's Wild Year
programme.desc: Japan is synonymous with crowded high tech cities. In fact around three-quarters of Japan is uninhabited forests, mountains and coast lines. Here a great diversity of wildlife ekes out an existence adapted to a country with great extremes of climate. From the tropics in the south to the sub-arctic climate of Hokkaido island. From the northernmost primates in the world, the snow monkeys, bears, giant hornets and the weird goat-antelope serow, to the iconic red-headed crane and the abundant cherry salmon, the life blood of Japanese rivers.

programme.title: Pond Stars E1
programme.desc: In the season opener, Greg and the crew work to install a giant pond for Tony and Shari, who want a larger home for their koi fish. Meanwhile, a client calls Greg to fix her current pond, but instead of fixing it, Greg transforms the bland backyard into a wild sanctuary. Working on their best to turn two backyards into entirely new ecosystems, the team races to get both projects done.

programme.title: Animal Fight Club S4E1
programme.desc: From the African Plains to the American Highlands, 'Clash of Titans' exposes nature, red in tooth and claw. Lions go head-to-head, a grey wolf pack takes on a grizzly, hippos hammer out a violent battle, and one of the world's largest monkeys plans a mission to murder. Lust, jealousy, and pure rage fuel deadly encounters in the wild, as the natural world shows its savage side.

programme.title: The Pack E1
programme.desc: A lone lion can hunt, and hunt well, but a pride will take on more and larger prey. We will study the battlefield to understand how a group of individuals develop the tactics and relationships needed and analyze their moves, revealing the nuances of the hunt as it's never been seen before. Discover how lions are pushing the limits of living in a pack.

programme.title: Unlikely Animal Friends S5E2 ?
programme.desc: This episode features a dairy goat nursing and protecting a motherless foal. They share hay and drink together every day like a family. A parrot and a boxer cuddle and stay side-by-side without apprehension. These unlikely pals will definitely leave you in sheer amazement.

programme.title: India's Wild Leopards
programme.desc: India may be the land of the Tiger, but it is also home to masters of stealth that prowl the deepest of jungles and the highest of mountains. Journey to Ladakh in the Himalaya in search of Snow Leopards - the ghost of the mountains. Then venture into the realm of the smallest of big cats - the Clouded Leopard in the jungles of north east India. Wildlife Cameraman & National Geographic Fellow, Sandesh Kadur is on a mission to uncover their secretive lives.

programme.title: The Pack E1
programme.desc: A lone lion can hunt, and hunt well, but a pride will take on more and larger prey. We will study the battlefield to understand how a group of individuals develop the tactics and relationships needed and analyze their moves, revealing the nuances of the hunt as it's never been seen before. Discover how lions are pushing the limits of living in a pack.

programme.title: Fish Tank Kings S2E2
programme.desc: Ben is too comfortable behind his desk at Living Color headquarters, so Mat assigns him the job of installing a pair of outsized fish tanks around a fireplace at the Reuss residence in Orlando. What seems like an ordinary job proves to be a challenge for Ben, as he must hone both his client relations and physical skills. Mat leaves for Chicago to work on a terrarium for a rare Panama Golden Frog.

programme.title: Animal Fight Club S3E2
programme.desc: In an all-American big cat showdown, a bobcat and a lynx fight tooth and claw for territory. Spanish fighting bulls show exactly what it means to have fighting in your genes as they go head-to-head to be the leaders of their herd. In the Sonoran Desert, a meat-eating mouse takes on one of the biggest centipedes on earth in a fight to the death.

programme.title: Wild Peru: Fight For Life
programme.desc: From Amazon rainforests to coastal deserts, wild Peru is among the most diverse and deadly places on Earth, bursting with vibrant life and sudden death. It's a varied landscape filled with danger for its inhabitants, who range from the expected to the extraordinary. Penguins, sea lions, spectacled bears, pumas, sloths, macaws, piranha and giant river otters are among the species that struggle to survive - and the outcomes can be surprising.

programme.title: Snakes In The City S4E1
programme.desc: Snake-catchers Simon and Siouxsie rush across Snake City to capture Africa's largest cobra in a pool, a python gatecrashes a wedding and an enormous black mamba terrorizes a neighborhood.

programme.title: Fish Tank Kings S2E2
programme.desc: Ben is too comfortable behind his desk at Living Color headquarters, so Mat assigns him the job of installing a pair of outsized fish tanks around a fireplace at the Reuss residence in Orlando. What seems like an ordinary job proves to be a challenge for Ben, as he must hone both his client relations and physical skills. Mat leaves for Chicago to work on a terrarium for a rare Panama Golden Frog.

programme.title: Snakes In The City S4E1
programme.desc: Snake-catchers Simon and Siouxsie rush across Snake City to capture Africa's largest cobra in a pool, a python gatecrashes a wedding and an enormous black mamba terrorizes a neighborhood.

programme.title: Freaks & Creeps E3
programme.desc: Lucy is in South Africa to see the enigmatic Freaky Five: cape vultures, sungazer girdled lizards, golden-brown baboon tarantulas, ground pangolins, and chacma baboons. These animals are all important to South Africans and their traditions but they have been overlooked for years. Now Lucy is on a mission to reveal the mysterious lives of those lesser-known creatures.

programme.title: World's Deadliest S2E1
programme.desc: In the animal kingdom there are covert assassins lurking in the shadows, ready to pounce at lightning speed to fight for survival and battle their foes. Possessing the skills to kill, these world's deadliest animals will use their jaw-dropping talents to fight to live another day. From stealthy cats to patient seals, giant centipedes to kick-boxing kangaroos, these are the Animal Ninja Warriors.

programme.title: Pond Stars E2
programme.desc: After long hours, some close calls and way too much grunt work, the new guy Chris is tasked to lead a complete backyard makeover for his own company's Marketing Manager, Tony, and he's ready to prove he can make the grade in the pond business. Meanwhile, Ed and Greg take a field trip to a nearby high school to construct a courtyard pond to be used as a perfect outdoor classroom.

programme.title: Animal Fight Club S4E2
programme.desc: The plains of Africa are home to nature's most fearsome predators: cheetahs, lions and hyenas. But the battle for survival is never one sided; even the prey can be formidable. We see a mother cheetah come face-to-face with the heavy weaponry of a Grants gazelle, and unpack what happens when three lions make the mistake of their lives and try to take down a pugnacious rhino.

programme.title: Snow Leopard Of Afghanistan
programme.desc: Nat Geo Wild joins the Wildlife Conservation Society (WCS) and an international team of experts, including biologist Boone Smith, to set out on a mission in Afghanistan to find, capture and collar a snow leopard, and release it back into the wild. If they are successful, the expedition can offer a deeper understanding of the rare and beautiful species.

programme.title: Snakes In The City S4E2
programme.desc: Simon and Siouxsie get called to remove an angry black mamba from a huge wood pile. After 5 hours of searching they eventually find it, and it is seriously angry. A vicious spitting cobra spits venom like mad when Simon tries to get it out of a tree cavity, and it takes them almost a month to trap an elusive forest cobra that's been terrorizing trailer park residents!

programme.title: Freaks & Creeps E1
programme.desc: Lucy heads off to the rainforests of Borneo where countless strange creatures live. Her goal is get up close with the giant-nosed proboscis monkey. Along the way, she finds many other 'odd ones' that have come up with strange adaptations to survive in Borneo, like frogs that fly, a tarsier with eyes that are bigger than its brain and the wooly bat that makes its home in a carnivorous plant.

programme.title: Snow Leopard Of Afghanistan

programme.title: A.R.C.H.I.E. 2
programme.desc: The super intelligent robotronic dog, Archie, befriends Gregory, a young boy who is the son of a carnival owner. Gregory is concerned that someone has been stealing from the carnival and enlists his new friend to help find the culprit.

programme.title: Madeline
programme.desc: The adventurous (and sometimes bordering mischievous) Madeline (Jones) and her 11 friends live in a school run by Miss Clavel (McDormand) in an old house in Paris. When the owner, Lord Covington (Hawthorne), abruptly decides to sell the house and the future of the school is in jeopardy, Madeline must use all her wits to mastermind a plan to scare off the buyers. Together with Pepito, the devilish son of the Spanish ambassador who lives next door, they must find a way to save the school while at the same time protect each other from harm.

programme.title: Legally Blonde
programme.desc: Elle Woods has it all. She's the president of her sorority, Miss June in her campus calendar, and dates the most popular boy in school. So, when he packs up for Harvard Law and reunites with his former flame, Ellie rallies all her resources and gets into Harvard, determined to win him back. But law school is a far cry from the comforts of her poolside and the mall. Elle must wage the battle of her life, for her guy, for herself and for all blondes.

programme.title: Bernie The Dolphin
programme.desc: A brother and sister befriend a badly sunburned dolphin separated from his family and uncover a secret plan that could destroy the beach and their new friend's home. The kids must devise a clever plan to save their best friend, Bernie.

programme.title: Evolution
programme.desc: When a meteor bearing single-celled organisms crashes to the Earth, the creatures begin to evolve at an exponentially rapid rate, resulting in fearsome aliens running amok and possibly spelling mankind's doom.

programme.title: The Bbq
programme.desc: Dazza has a passion for barbequing, but when he accidentally gives his neighbours food poisoning, Dazza's reputation is on the line. To make amends he seeks help from a tyrannical Scottish chef and together they'll enter a competition.

programme.title: Paulie
programme.desc: Paulie, a disobedient talking parrot, sets out to look for his original owner and discovers his way with words may cause him big troubles. During the journey, He meets a Russian janitor who helps him till the end.

programme.title: Little Women (1994)
programme.desc: Based on Louisa May Alcotts classic novel, the film adaptation relates the dramas and adventures of Mrs. March's four 'little women' - spirited Jo, beautiful Meg, fragile Beth and romantic Amy - and serves as a glowing depiction of 19th century family life and a tribute to family strength and feminine independence.

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: The stars of a 1970s sci-fi show - now scraping a living through re-runs and sci-fi conventions - are beamed aboard an alien spacecraft. Believing the cast's heroic on-screen dramas are historical documents of real-life adventures, the band of aliens turn to the ailing celebrities for help in their quest to overcome the oppressive regime in their solar system.

programme.title: Evolution
programme.desc: When a meteor bearing single-celled organisms crashes to the Earth, the creatures begin to evolve at an exponentially rapid rate, resulting in fearsome aliens running amok and possibly spelling mankind's doom.

programme.title: Annie
programme.desc: Adapted from the smash Broadway musical, Annie (Quinn) is a spunky little girl who lives in an orphanage run by the boozy, tyrannical Miss Hannigan (Burnett). Annie's hopes of finding her dream family soars when multigazillionaire Oliver Warbucks (Finney) decides to take in an orphan for a week to 'upgrade his image”. However, as her dreams become closer to reality, Miss Hannigan is around the corner conspiring to ruin it all and it is up to Annie's friends to rescue her before it's too late.

programme.title: Away And Back
programme.desc: Hostility turns into something else between a widowed farmer and a pushy ornithologist who came to his farm to save a family of swans. Could romance be in the air?

programme.title: Terra Willy: Unexplored Planet
programme.desc: Following the destruction of their ship, young Willy is separated from his parents with whom he traveled through space. His rescue capsule lands on a wild and unexplored planet. With the help of Buck, a survival robot, he will have to hold on until the arrival of a rescue mission.

programme.title: Camp Cool Kids
programme.desc: Encouraged by his quirky grandfather, a young boy faces his fears at summer camp where it's the dweebs against the bullies.

programme.desc: Brad Whitaker is a radio host trying to get his stepchildren to love him and call him Dad. But his plans turn upside down when their biological father, Dusty Mayron, returns.

programme.title: The Last Dragonslayer
programme.desc: Orphaned, indentured, seemingly with little prospects, Jennifer Strange is thrust reluctantly into the controversial dragonslaying business, where she must do the right thing, even if the power of the king is against her.

programme.title: Hope Dances
programme.desc: Hope Douglas has a dream but her parents have thrown her into battle between playing sports and dancing ballet. When a tragedy strikes, Hope has to make a difficult choice that will decide her fate - which way does she go?

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: Join Kermit, Miss Piggy and the rest of the Muppet personalities on a fun,filled romp down the great white way. After a successful college run, the Muppets decide to take their musical 'Manhattan Melodies' to Broadway. They are starry,eyed innocents until they meet sleazy producers like Dabney Coleman who holds a chicken hostage and drags Gonzo by his beak. Soon they learn that there is more to Broadway than the smell of the grease paint and the roar of the crowd. After a series of setbacks, they eventually do take Manhattan and Miss Piggy takes Kermit, her beloved frog, to the altar. Everyone turns out for the Broadway wedding including a tearful Cookie Monster, Ernie and Bert. Cleverly directed by Frank Oz, the movie features special guest star appearances by Joan Rivers, Elliot Gould, Liza Minnelli, James Coco, Art Carney and Gregory Hines. THE MUPPETS TAKE MANHATTAN is brimming with cuteness, sophistication and fantasy, filled fun!

With the emergence of Electro, Peter must confront a foe far more powerful than himself. And as his old friend, Harry Osborn, returns, Peter comes to realize that all of his enemies have one thing in common: Oscorp.
